intro: Apterokarpos gardneri, commonly known as the Natal yellowwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale grey bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by small, round fruits containing a single seed. It is adapted to coastal and mountainous regions, often growing in well-drained soils and showing some resistance to coastal salt spray.
